website_summaries.verdict: The 4500 is a good medium range workhorse model, with wet/dry capacity and a powerful but quiet motor. Includes a basic beard/sideburn trimmer attachment.
pros: Gentle on skin, very little irritation reported
Long operational time on a single charge, no fade
cons: Does not contain a power meter display
Shave closeness is variable, not as good as traditional razor

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this no matter the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a pile of garbage. First, the heads spin quite slowly. So it doesn't cut well at all. Dull blades probably do not help the cause. Add to that the issue of the entire head falling off and not reassembling correctly and I now have a paperweight after about two weeks of use. I guess I could try to fix it with some time and elbow grease, but I don't know the point as if I was successful at fixing, all I would have is a subpar razor. Pass.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy J. Buske

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper is better.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this shaver's performance and its relatively low cost ($60). Previously, I had been using the Norelco 8900 series shavers at about $200 for the shaver and cleaner package. By comparison the 4500 shaver shaves faster and with less irritation, especially if you don't shave every day. Also cleaning is easy, since all that is required is to flip the shaver head and run it under a stream of warm water to rinse the stubble that collected during the shave. This cleans the shaver for the next shave. The flip up side burn trimmer is much easier to use. In summary, for $60, this is an excellent shaver and performs better than the $200 Norelco shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old Norelco.  Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.text: Internal rechargeable battery failed after just five months. Contacted Norelco service center and spoke with barely literate customer service agent. Took at least 30 minutes to make simple warranty claim. They sent me a new unit, which was broken right out of the box. Called customer service again and reached a guy who sounded like he was fading in and out of consciousness and needed to be drug-tested. Asked for supervisor and was disconnected. Called back in, recording said call back another time because they are too busy to take more calls. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: gpslouis

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: There is no indication when the battery is running low. You are shaving and all at once the razor stops. You plug the razor into the AC outlet. Nothing happens. You are stuck with a half shaved face. My last Norelco you could plug it in and the razor would work.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Comfy Shaver
customer_reviews.text: The Philips norcelo 4500 shaver is awsome. It feels very smooth on your skin and easy to operate. It has a very good batter life and best part is that you can operate it both wet and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Bipin Goenka

customer_reviews.title: Close shave
customer_reviews.text: Have been scruffy for weeks. Now the ladies are enjoying the fresh face.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis R.

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: I have been using electric razors for close to 50 years. The majority of my razors were Norelco because they performed well. When my last razor up and died I found this razor and was happy. A norelco at a reasonable price. I should not have been as this is flat out the worst electric razor I ever used. It scraped the skin but did not cut the whiskers. Great combination and the reason it is now in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: G. B. Berns

customer_reviews.title: J. Snyder
customer_reviews.text: I have a old Norelco that has lasted over 25 years so I bought this one and it is a piece of junk. When I first got it it left full hairs on my face and none was cut smooth and I thought it would improve with use. It has become worse as time went by and now won't cut hardly at all.. I do like the feature of washing it under running water and that is why I give it one star
customer_reviews.author: R. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: my 13 year old corded Norelco works just as good if not better and it's a lot easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: Because it's cordless it's convenient...but to be honest, my 13 year old corded Norelco works just as good if not better and it's a lot easier to clean....the quality of the blades in this newer one are no where near as good as the older one. UPDATE: I think I'd give this a ONE STAR now....after using it regularly it is obvious that the quality of the razor is inferior to the standards I expected from Norelco based on previous products of theirs. Flat out, the shaving head is garbage. After use, when you go to clean it be ready for it to all fall apart....this is really junk...especially for the price. AVOID THIS PRODUCT--NOT WORTH THE MONEY !!!
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Defective head opener & hinge after short period of use. No cost effective remedy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nine months ago and began taking it on trips and using it regularly about a month ago. Almost immediately, the shaver head (which has the three circular blades), began popping open spontaneously, and eventually could not be kept shut because the hinge mechanism was defective, not necessarily the time I purchased it, but after very little use. Now that the shaver is about 10 months old, I am without any cost effective remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Miller

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I have an identical razor that was made a few years earlier and it was made in the Netherlands. Now Made in China for the cost to me the consumer when you know it was less expensive for Norelco. I have used Norelco razors for 40 years. I will look for another model Norelco that is not made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Guggenmos

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I decided to switch from blades to electric because I thought it would make shaving easier, faster, and less messy. Not only does it take just as long to shave with this razor, but it still requires clean up and DOES NOT SHAVE AS CLOSE AS A BLADE! I would return this item right now if I hadn't thrown away the box. If you're thinking of switching from blade shaving to an electric for convenience, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yuma

customer_reviews.title: Get the Braun
customer_reviews.text: i keep buying Norelcos and i keep being disappointed. i have to go over my face again and again with this thing. i know Braun is a better machine but i keep compromising on price and end up with something i don't like. i have a 20 year old Braun travel razor that i bought for $10 that works better than this Norelco.
customer_reviews.author: Trip Affleck

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: One full week in use and it does a pretty good job -- even slightly better than my $200 Phillips-Norelco 3D sensotouch I had been using. Holds a charge well and doesn't make a mess with the cuttings all over the counter like my old one did. I only knocked off 1 star because the flip-up sideburn trimmer is a flimsy design and must be used at a very specific angle to avoid having the mechanism fold back down on you. The trimmers that pop straight out (rather than fold up) seem to be much sturdier and can be used at any angle. Overall, a very good value compared to more expensive shavers and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife downgraded to a better shave!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. She and I both had much higher-end Norelco's, but I switched to this one after doing my research and it seems to function better than the more expensive "gizmo-laden" models. Plus, the heads are much cheaper to replace. Wet/dry.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: “Oldie but Goodie”
customer_reviews.text: Men’s shaving is highly subjective when it comes to evaluating shavers. With this caveat, I found this Norelco shaver to be far superior to other more recent Norelco models that feature elevated floating heads. It gives a very close shave with minimal facial and neck irritation. Two suggestions: (1) don’t apply pressure! Just let the razor glide over your face and neck. (2) keep it fully charged. It’s performance does noticeably degrade as it loses its charge. I feel that this is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Classicalmusiclover

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT !!
customer_reviews.text: This is about my 5th -6th Norelco shaver and it is great on my ridiculously heavy beard. The cheaper models are made with softer steel and not a value. The more costly Phillips Norelco brand is the best value in the long run. This particular razor was bought over a year ago and is still going strong. When it starts "snagging" me, I'll replace it with the exact same brand/type. Easy clean, rinse with water after using.
customer_reviews.author: cc99

customer_reviews.title: Beware when you need replacement blades!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product expecting a razor that would last many years. What I got was a razor that was serviceable (not great) for about a year. Then it came time to replace the blades. As it turns out, the replacement blades for this razor are not nearly as good as the original blades. I called Norelco to see how I could get "original" blades and they told me that they change the blades all the time. Well, apparently, the blades that they made when I originally bought this aren't produced anymore. Product is basically worthless as the new blades just don't really work well at well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Shaving head broke when cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Got this a month ago to replace my old one. I had the old one for many years and thought it was great. Well this one was also great while it lasted. Clean shaving, no pain, etc. PROBLEM IS: it only lasted for exactly one month before the shaving head broke and the machine thus rendered useless and now I need a new HQ8 shaving head. Just another 30 dollars down the drain along with my trust of Philips’ products’ quality.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: EDITED!! I no LONGER hate it!
customer_reviews.text: EDIT I reached out to them and they sent me a new set of heads that fixed the problem immediately. Below is my original comment. LOVE it now This noisy irritating thing is the 13th purchase from this company in this style of razor in my life. It's the WORST shave ever. It was crap right out of the box, never had a close shave out if it yet even using cream. It's so LOUD now I don't even want it near me.
customer_reviews.author: Cigarhead

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Philips Norelco shavers for almost 15 years, and this one does not disappoint. The battery life is excellent, the quality of the cut is super smooth, and overall, I'm really happy with this purchase. I charge my shaver about every 3 weeks, and when I do charge, the unit is fully charged in about 3 hours. Super easy to travel with, too.... just put the shaver head cover on and put into my toiletry bag. Generally, my trips are 3-4 days at most, so I don't need to worry about bringing a charger.
customer_reviews.author: TrueFocus

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Norelco shaver for a number of years. My previous Norelco shaver kept going but was losing some of its ability to give me a clean shave. Buying new blades for my older one may have worked but the cost of a new shaver was not much more so I got it. The new shaver gives me a good shave but it lacks the ability to be used when charging. The previous one could do that. It also doesn't come with a case. No problem there since I still had the case for the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: WestM

customer_reviews.title: Provides Me a Very Good Shave
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new design Norelco 8900 shaver in 2018 but was never really happy with it from a design standpoint and the shave I got was so-so- so. Finely desired to go back to the tried and true design of the Norelco shavers I'd use previously and so bought this shaver. While I've only been using it about 1 week, I couldn't be happier. It just gives a much better shave, at least for me, than the more expensive Norelco model I owned.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN in CA

customer_reviews.title: New Norelco, not blade replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought replacement heads, but was not handy enough to install them. It was too tricky for me. So I bought a New Norelco. It is a great shaver...Norelco is not as fussy as foil shavers...Norelco will gobble-up all types of hair. By the way, I also use this to shave my calves and reduce the thigh hair.....I personally think having hairy calves is not an athletic look at the gym or pool...started doing this decades ago when the swim coach told us to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I usually have good luck buying things on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: You would think that for $60.00 this thing would have a charging stand to simply sit the shaver in for a recharge. Uh uh. you have to lie it somewhere and plug the charging cord directly into the shaver. Also, this review may be premature...Why? Might have more to add. This thing has been charging for over 8 hours, and still won't go on. I'll give it till the morning and then send it back. I usually have good luck buying things on Amazon, but my luck may have run out.
customer_reviews.author: wayne Muller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Finally an electric razor that works
customer_reviews.text: Heard a lot of negative reviews on this. Motor slow, not good shave. Not sure what they are looking for but this is perfect. I have thick rough facial hair and this smoothly cuts through it. Close comfortable shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Tried Going Cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I used a Norelco for the first time about 20 years ago. After that, I couldn't understand why anyone took the time to use blades. When I lost that razor I decided to just go cheaper. Why pay for the brand? I think I tried 3 different ones before I finally realized I was wasting more money in the long run. Great razor. I work from home so I go long periods of time without shaving. With the other razors I would have to use a beard trimmer first or it hurt like crazy. With this one I can go a week and not have to trim first!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as the high end shavers
customer_reviews.text: I have had a couple of the high end shavers and can say that, for me, this shaver does just as good a job. Now, I don't claim to have a 'tough' beard; but I think mine is like most guys. I've had it for about 2 years and use it every morning - get a good shave in about 5 minutes and only charge it once a week although I could go longer. It's easy to clean but if you want to do a thorough clean, you have to take several pieces off. It's not hard to do but it's a bit of a process. I do it about once a month. It's light and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Chilly Mo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shaver!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been a fan of electric shavers. all my life I've shaved with a blade. I recently shaved my head. (thining hair). And I was having difficulty shaving my head with a blade, i always cut myself. so i had to walk around with tissue on my head. (not a good look at all). So I decided to take a chance with this shaver. and was I shocked!!!! It shaves my head with no shaver burn, its very close, and I don't cut myself. I recommend wet, with shaving cream. I'll NEVER go back to blade shaving. Norelco you hit the ball out of the park with this shaver!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: kell

customer_reviews.title: Reliable , easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Norelco, and I am very happy with it. It charges and holds the charge. This One is much easier to clean then the previous versions. Very good shave. Recommend it highly
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better!
customer_reviews.text: I am use to a razor shave, but since I now have health issues, I need a shaver. So that being said, the shave is not nearly as good as a razor. I have a feeling there are way better closer electric shavers out there that give a super close clean shave. The battery life is good. Only plugged it in as the initial start up in March 2020. It is now May, 2020 and still does not need a charge. In the future, I will definitely buy a better brand, possibly paying a wee bit more, but for now...It does the job & it Could Be Better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for a long time. I rinsed it out often. Then, I think I didn't let it dry out, and I rusted it. I bought another just like it because it is comfortable and easy to use. Some out there, might cut a little better, but the prices are outrageous. Unless you look at yourself with a magnifying glass, this one works just fine. Because it's cordless, I leave it next to my desk. Always there when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 6 months but then...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months but then stopped cutting well. Cutting got so bad that it hardly cut my neck area. Debated about buying replacement blades even though I was only 6 months into the original blades. I looked into their cost and how to replace the blades and thought it simply wasn't worth it. I tossed it in the garbage can and wrote it off as a poor purchase on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A. Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: Still Working Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for a number of years now. It's been a good device, as you'd expect from Phillips. I love the flexibility of the individual shaving heads and the period between recharges is impressive. I've used it while traveling to Europe and Australia and it's easy to carry and doesn't weigh much. My only criticism is that this is not a razor that likes more than a two days growth on my face. It just doesn't cut the whiskers without a lot of user effort.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband was completely thrilled with this particular style. In the past he bought the cheaper versions that sold for under $30. The cheaper versions as my husband tells me never really did the job he have to go over area several times to get a close shave. Those over once with this one doesn’t have to do it a second time. My husband is very very picky
customer_reviews.author: Laurel P. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Not A Great Razor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this razor because in the past I owned three other Norelco razors,and all were excellent. However ,this razor was mediocre at best. It is extreme,y difficult to thoroughly clean and reassemble, gives a poor shave after 10 minutes of shaving, and. appears go be poorly or cheaply manufactured. I will keep the razor,bjut my old Remington razor which kit. 6 years old gives a better shave and ks easier to clean and reassemble. Due to the above, I cannot recommend this razor... On the positive side, it is very quiet and if you don't mind shaving for over 10 minutes , it will give you a fair shave.
customer_reviews.author: Ed  L.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this. My old one was almost 12 years old. Only changed blades once. I originally got the old one for a Christmas gift and when box was under the tree our Westie puppy chewed it up. Westie puppies are known for this. Was able to salvage the blades and used it on the one I purchased after she chewed up the first. . Love this one because of the lithium battery and it does give me a great shave.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S. Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Razor, just like the last one (20 yrs ago).
customer_reviews.text: This razor is just wonderful. My husband is VERY pleased. His old one, from about 20 years ago, was still working fine but was not holding a charge like it used to. I just ordered this one as a 'surprise' if you will and put it in the bathroom for him. He was really surprised and so pleased. It is a great razor at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Carry a long.
customer_reviews.text: Read the head line. I am almost 60 and have used this item or over 40 years. I've tried the rest and the is no better, but it could be nice if you included a carrying case that protected it and its, cord, brushes and what ever in a nice carry a long bag. Thanks for coinciding my advice., Dave.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lankin

customer_reviews.title: Such a deal for good shaver
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is fantastic. The cost is reasonable too. I have used Norelco shavers for a long time (about 60 yrs) and after research this is best one at good price. This must be a popular model with so many reviews and it is $30 more at most other stores. Can’t go wrong with Norelco from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BroRon

customer_reviews.title: Not the best shave
customer_reviews.text: I had a Norelco shaver that did a good job, but got rather old. I thought it was time to get a new one. This one doesn't do a good job, not even as good as the old one did after years of service. I would NOT buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: Like many long-time Norelco users I've been very disappointed with recent models - particularly one I spent big bucks on. This one works well, has a reasonable battery life, cleans easily under the faucet, and isn't too expensive. At first it seemed to me to run too slowly - like the older models when running out of charge - but that must be by design as it cuts through my beard cleanly and easily.
customer_reviews.author: PLW

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Good basic shaver with a really good pop-up trimmer. Overpriced at its normal selling price; the Father's Day deals are best. It does an adequate to good job of catching most whiskers if you adopt the constant rotary motion and skin stretching technique recommended by the manufacturer. It is relatively easy to clean. One negative is that it doesn't work just with the charge cord. When the batteries fail; the shaver is done. Bad design! Ergonomic design is adequate; but an Asian hand does not usually resemble my hand. You have to take extra care not to drop the shaver. The charge cord/adapter seem sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: One Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Good and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: They have not changed this razor in years. I inherited one from my dad when he passed on. It is pretty old but it still works fine. He never replaced anything on it. My new version is essentially identical to his old one. I figure it will last forever. It is a little slow if I have not shaved for a couple days but otherwise it does the job just as I expected it would. The price is also reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not a shave goes by where I don't regret buying this abominable contraption
customer_reviews.text: Not a shave goes by where I don't regret buying this abominable contraption. It is so rough that I spend 3 times longer than I would using a razor, and by that point my skin is so inflamed that I swear I'll never use it again. But I remember how Norelco used to be, and keep giving them a second chances. Good riddance, it's only razors and cream from now on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waggenspack

customer_reviews.title: Norelco is as dependable as ever
customer_reviews.text: Product came just as expected, brand new in a sealed box. Included was the razor, a cleaning brush, and the power cord. I had a norelco electric shaver years ago so I was really looking forward to getting this. I’m not disappointed at all so far; it works great and leaves my skin smooth. Comparing it though to my previous one (model I can’t remember, it was back in the 1980s) this one feels very light. I remember the previous one sounding a lot louder too. This one is deceptively quieter but definitely gives a great shave.
customer_reviews.author: Legion

customer_reviews.title: Really gives a close shave
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a very thick beard and did not believe that he would ever get a smooth shave from an electric razor. He told me I would have to pay a lot to get one that would really work on his beard. Guess what? I proved him wrong :-). It works very well and leaves his face very smooth and was not very expensive. I would totally recommend this razor for tough beards.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Poor shave results
customer_reviews.text: This motor doesn't seem to be working right. Very slow moving and pulls on my whiskers. I am going to return item.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Norelco has gone to Hell
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to get a decent shaver from norelco anymore. The model at830 is about on par with a 1936 Chevey car. It is so very noisy and run at about half speed compared to my model at875 that uses the HQ8 blades that they no longer sell. The blades they list as a replacement are absolute JUNK. The H50/52 blades are so cheap they only last a few months if that. The shaver that they are forcing onto us is a goofy one with the head separated from the body of the shaver. It is so small it can only be used by the Ladies, or held by your pointer finger an thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hansen

customer_reviews.title: How does it know that the warranty is up?
customer_reviews.text: I'm addicted to these Norelcos. I hate myself a little bit for it. Either the battery or the power button gives out right after the warranty is done. Neither one is user replaceable. So I drop another $80-90. Again. This is my fourth or fifth one. My last one died on vacation, so I borrowed my son's Remington for a week until I could get a replacement. Reminded me of why I keep buying these. If only I could permanently laser the hair off of my face.
customer_reviews.author: brake16

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great affordable shaver
customer_reviews.text: I've had Norelco shaver before but this is so quiet you'd think it wouldn't work but it shaves very closely. My face is still getting used to it after more than 3 weeks. (i only shave about twice per week) Thing I don't like is: they say it's to be rinsed under a warm tap water faucet but I saw water run out the bottom through the charging port. I'll use the enclosed brush from now on. Update: still working great. I use a can of pressurized air for cleaning hair. I'll probably use hot tap water to get skill oils, etc. Out of the blades from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: BXC

customer_reviews.title: Shaves like old Norelcos used to!
customer_reviews.text: It actually works! That's the most important point. Newer models fail to give me a good shave. This one did. And it was an incredibly reasonable price. I'm thinking about buying a few more to keep as a supply in case the end times come...
customer_reviews.author: Moderate American

customer_reviews.title: Clean smooth finish with no irritation
customer_reviews.text: I am a cosmetologist with a handful a male customers. I have always used my Wahl 5star shaper/shaver to get that extra smooth feel after shaping/lining. Although it worked wonderfully, it irritated the skin of my Caucasian customer. He had an OLD Phillips that I would use that worked like my Wahl but without irritation. I thought I would see If I could find one. I find that the Phillips works on all my customers so far. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Hair to Serve

customer_reviews.title: Shaves well with decent battery life.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is happy with this shaver. It replaces an earlier model that died. This one was chosen because it uses the same shaving heads as the first. It gives him a decent shave and has a good battery life. It is a pain to deep clean, but that seems to be normal for shavers. At least he can’t cut himself with this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Bev T

customer_reviews.title: A Magnificent Tool !
customer_reviews.text: Personally; I love it. Just pick up a cordless, and go shave. I used it just a little while ago. Here is the thing though; You need to keep the blades oiled because they are self sharpening; but if You do; it will cause the cut hair to bunch up, and not fall freely into the bottom of the razor; which means that You will have to wash it out under a hydrant with hot water, in order to clean it. After the water air dries. then You will need to oil it again. That's just the way it is. I have not repented of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brown

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this exact model shaver for several years & have replaced heads 2 or 3 times. Was needing heads again & I saw this on Amazon site. Decided to just buy new instead of replacing heads which are about 1/2 the price of new shaver. This thing does not have nearly the power of my old one. Used it twice & could not believe how poorly it measured up!! Shipping it back & will replace heads.
customer_reviews.author: rbh827

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandpa. He had just gotten a shoulder replacement and didn't have mobility in that arm to continue shaving with a razor. He was able to pick this up and use it no problem and appreciated being able to stay clean-shaven during recovery.
customer_reviews.author: rainydaysunset

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver with a poor battery
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other brands and always come back to Norelco, and especially this type. However, this time the battery lasted only 14 months before dying. EDIT: I called Philips to ask about warranty replacement. The rep was very pleasant and helpful, asked me a few questions, and offered to ship me a replacement shaver and the means to return the old one. Very good customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Hud H

customer_reviews.title: Quality Philips Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father to replace and older model he's been holding onto for the last few years. He's adverse to change but he was very happy with this shaver because even though it's a newer model is feels and functions the same as his older one. And yes, the packaging was frustration free. All of the components were placed in a box, free of any plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea G.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made CHINESE KNOCK OFF.
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using Phillips/Norelco razors for about 55 years. Hated trying to shave out of my steel helmet in the field so I bought a battery powered one. I have been using them ever since. This thing is not a sorry Chinese made piece of junk. The blades instead of having 3 or 4 cutting circles on each blade only have one cutting ring circle. The articulation of the blades is very limited compared to a razor made in the US or the Netherlands. Do not waste your time and money on this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this purchase, I use it when I’m running late and don’t have time for a full shave with shaving cream and a razor, it gives a decent close shave, it was purchased when I broke my wrist and had to shave left handed works well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent electric shaver
customer_reviews.text: Gives a very close shave without much pressure on the skin. If you have a heavy beard; this probably isn't the perfect shaver for you. If use it after not shaving for 2-3 days; It strangely will not cut everything leaving long strands of hair untouched. I either have to pivot the shaver in lots of different directions to get those last strands or finish up with a straight razor.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW HARRISON

customer_reviews.title: I feel this is important. I could NOT register my shaver with Norelco on their website.
customer_reviews.text: They said to register it on social media. I am glad I don't do that with my Jeep! I just shaved my face and head and it did a great job. And its not that loud. If you shave with rest of the family asleep, it should not wake them up. Maybe the house cat or dog. And it says I should not need to change the shaver head for a whole year. That will save me money on ordering new shave heads.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older Norelco
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older model that I have had for many years. This new razor is super. It works much better than the old one which I had replace the cutters on. The switch in the old one went bad so I bought the new one. I would really recommend this razor. The price is super and it gives a really close shave.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: 2 Days past the support widow
customer_reviews.text: This is my second razor of this model. My first one lasted several years as did my previous Norelco models. This one will not hold a charge. The problem did not appear within the couple of months allowed for support. I am disappointed in the very short warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Why me

customer_reviews.title: Fine shaver, but NOT suitable for Nickel Allergies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaver to replace a Panasonic foil shaver that had produced bumps from a Nickel allergy. This shaver is touted as hypoallergenic and suitable for those with Nickel allergies. The shaver performs fine, and although simply featured, generally gives a good shave, but it produced the same Nickel allergy reaction. I wish I could return it, but I gave it a good try. Save yourself the grief if you have a Nickel allergy and look elsewhere for an electric shaver.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Shameful Evolution
customer_reviews.text: I used the Norelco shaver 6891XL for forty years. It was perfect. It fits in the palm like a glove. It shaves similar to a straight razor and trims the beard. After forty years of use, the beard feature failed. So I bought the Philips Norelco AT830/41 Shaver 4500. It is a total disappointment. Shaving leaves distinct stubs which are impossible to remove - it doesn't matter how I hold the shaver or how many times I go over the area. it is heavier than the previous one and doesn't fit in the palm. Now, I use two shavers, the old one for shaving and the new one for trimming my beard. A very unfortunate evolution for a renown company.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Louise Tuvim

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I should have went with the next better model
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift, I feel like I should have went with the next better model. This razor, compared to others I have seen, just feels lighter in the hands. When I say lighter, I don’t mean in a good way. I mean in terms of the quality of the workmanship. I asked the person who I purchased it for and his opinion was that while it still gives a close shave, it irritated his skin more than his previous Philips Norelco Shaver that had a more solid feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: FiveSky

customer_reviews.title: On/off switch is colored black like the rest of the shaver.
customer_reviews.text: My husband shaves with this and it seems to work well. One complaint I have is that it's difficult for him to see the on/off switch, since it's black like the rest of the shaver -- not helpful for someone with macular degeneration and glaucoma, not to mention Alzheimer's. I also miss the recharging stand that came with the old shaver. I rest it on top of the bananas when recharging it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris from Natick

customer_reviews.title: A closer shave than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't tried an electric shaver in a long time and I was pretty pleasantly surprised by this one. I mostly use for a dry shave and the cut ended up being closer than I expected. I find myself shaving a lot more frequently, as this Norelco is very convenient and does a decent enough shave. You don't quite get that same smoothness that you would with a razor (unless you spend a really long time going at it), but it's good enough for government work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband hates this item.
customer_reviews.text: After checking out several electric razors on Amazon, my husband selected this one. He has tried an tried to use it, but came out of the bathroom two days ago and told me "that razor is just a piece of junk." He said it pulls his whiskers and hurts his skin. We would like to return it, but don't know if that's possible at this point. We got it in late February/early March.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyeBee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shaver, but VERY disappointed that it didn't include a protective case
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent shaver. I'm a devoted Norelco user, but I was shocked and disappointed when it arrived without a zipper case to protect it during travel. This was an expensive device and it should come with a protective case as did the many other Norelco shavers I have bought over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Luther

customer_reviews.title: This Shaver work VERY WELL!!
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened the shipping box and began to use this razor, it has performed flawlessly and provided me with an outstanding shave every time I've used it! I am still amazed at how smooth it is, I cannot feel it doing anything, other than providing a clean, good shave!! I honestly wish I had bought this several months ago! Great Shaver!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. McMillan

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea...
customer_reviews.text: That electric razors could work this well. Wet or dry I’ve found it to be impressive at getting my head and face smooth. No-one at the office believes I’m shaving with an electric razor!
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Banerjee

customer_reviews.title: A good razor
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older advanced model Norelco razor with this simpler model. It works fine for me and does the same job as the newer more advanced models do. So I am satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.TE

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasted  only 13 months
customer_reviews.text: My major complaints are that you cannot shave with this model while it is charging, the battery indicator gives very little notice that the battery is low before it quits shaving, and the battery only lasted 13 months, by far the least amount of time for any rechargeable shaver I have ever owned. Naturally it quit just after I had purchased a new set of expensive shaver heads. What a ripoff! Philips Norelco should be ashamed. Don't waste your money on this model!!!
customer_reviews.author: Claude M. Laird

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a Christmas present. He has sensitive skin and wanted to upgrade from traditional razors to an electric so I settled on this model. It works really well and he has no skin irritation! The only complaint he has is that you need to go over coarse hairs two or three times to get a full smooth shave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little razor.
customer_reviews.text: Great little razor. Charge holds well. You have to clean it regularly. Pretty sturdy, but dont throw it on the ground or anything. Depending on the usage you will need to change heads periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Fugzine

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Completely fell apart after receiving 2 months ago. Will have to contact the manufacturer as the return window closed the end of February
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Yes and No
customer_reviews.text: I've used Norelco shavers for many years and this is one of the best. They keep improving the technology. Nice, clean shave as I've come to expect from Norelco. In fact, better than my previous Norelco shavers. Well recommended Downside: I was pretty ticked that I couldn't replace the battery when it's time is up. I replaced batteries on my previous Norelco shavers on more than one occasion and maximized the life of the shaver. I'm guessing Phillips hates that so the non-replaceable battery model is their "solution". Shave 5-stars. Customer satisfaction 3-stars (due to battery stupidity). Tempted to look at other brands of shavers next time...
customer_reviews.author: Radio Ross

customer_reviews.title: The best Norelco I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I hate to think how many Norelco shavers I've owned over the years. They all started out OK but the heads just didn't last and on the last one, they changed the head design and it was horrible. This is a great, simple shaver that provides a good shave with comfort. And, the charge can last almost three weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Agent 19

customer_reviews.title: Back to a rotary shaver
customer_reviews.text: Bought a foil shaver several months ago. Takes too much time to shave properly. However, returned to the trusty Norelco and am enjoying a quick, clean shave once again.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Easiest on the skin
customer_reviews.text: Much easier on the skin because there's no need to press hard to my face to pick up all the stubble. Easy to clean. Wish there was a way to tell the remaining charge level.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best Norelco for me
customer_reviews.text: I've had three Norelcos in my life. This one gives the smoothest shave of any of them with no pulling. It is quieter than the older ones and feels good from the start. I avoided the expensive choices because this one was a familiar style and I didn't want the experience many had wit them. To the folks who feel passing over whiskers a few times to get a nice shave is not their cup of tea, hey, even a pricey blade and lather usually needs more than one pass.
customer_reviews.author: Whippersnapper

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like and keep this product, but I had to return it. I was shaving my face, which I had to trim first, and it the shaver had gotten almost all the hair. I'd say about 98% of it. However, there were a few hairs that the shaver refused to cut. I tried for 10 to 15 minutes without any luck. I had to use a razor to clean up, which for me defeated the purpose. On the other hand, Philip's body hair trimmer is wonderful and I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Imran Khan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Razon
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my eight year old Norelco Razor with this one and I am just as happy. My old Norelco works well with blades that had been resharpened, but this one is so much better with newer technology over the old one. Real close shave, does not pull the skin, shaves in any direction, easy to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Morris

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best electric shavers I have purchased in the last 20 years. Was very surprised at how close of a shave I was able to achieve with this model. I have gone through probably 6 other electric shavers the last 20 years, and they always left a light stubble, and poor battery life. I have to shave everyday for work. And I can get by recharging this once a month. Call me impressed. Keep it up Philips!
customer_reviews.author: Bloodvayne

customer_reviews.title: Save 18 hours a year in shaving time
customer_reviews.text: This product cuts as clean as a razor in 1/4 of the time that I spent shaving with foam. 1 minute or less with the the remington. 4 minutes with a razor blade. 365 minutes = 6 hours. 1460 minutes = 24 hours. Imagine what you can do with those extra 18 hours! Its like an extra day off do stuff you like.
customer_reviews.author: Dreams-of-Hobbits

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable razor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this razor to replace the same model razor I bought nearly eighteen years ago. It is easy to clean by simply opening the razor head and flushing with warm water. I generally recharge it after six or seven shaves so it is always ready to use and my experience is that it holds a charge well.
customer_reviews.author: Opajimmy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Well, he likes it because it’s very similar to his old one. The “floating “ head was new to him but a non-issue. I don’t recall an issue with packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Bates

customer_reviews.title: Got a great shave on my heavy steel beard!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 2: after 1 year the battery red light comes on just after recharge and 1 use! UPDATE 1 after using a couple days: The charging plug at the shaver disengages with the slightest bump! Hence, I dropped to 4 stars. I only buy Norelco shavers, and almost returned this one because the heads have fewer cutting blades than my worn out Speed XL, but not a problem. I got a great, smoothe shave this morning on its first shakedown cruise!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kitsko

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver it a Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Braun 790cc Shaver and gave it away, I could not get a good shave with it, and it cost over $200. and this one was $60. and it work 10 times better and this one is so quit some times I'm not sure it even on, The charge last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Withey

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent electric razor. It trims much closer than the ones selling at half the price. It also is easy to clean under a water tap and can be used to shave wet, although I personally recommend shaving on a dry, clean face. You would do well to pay the extra money over the less expensive Norelco series.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Barrister

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery life
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 10/16 and the battery is already gone bad. Fully charged and can only shave half my face. For the price, you’d think that the battery would last. Older version prior to this one lasted 5 years. Must be made in the USA of China nowadays!
customer_reviews.author: gb

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging
customer_reviews.text: It has stopped charging already. Very unhappy as my return date has come and gone a month ago. We've had this razor before and had no issues. Cannot afford another one.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: Shaver has sharp blades and a quiet motor.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an earlier Norelco without an attached trimmer. To date I am still working on the original charge,going on 11 days and that is close to the announced 50 minutes of shaving. I hope that when the battery charge runs low it will give one last shave before recharging.
customer_reviews.author: SLasley

customer_reviews.title: Great wet/dry shaver...
customer_reviews.text: I had a goatee for 20 years until I bought this shaver. I always would cut the dimple on my chin shaving and my face cuts easy, so it is easier to have facial hair. This shaver makes it easy to not have facial hair. I got a shower mirror and shower and shave with soap or shave dry before going out for something. It is quick and easy. And for me it doesn't leave my face cut. Great shaver and I got it for a steal on Father's Day. Great Father's Day deal Amazon, 2 thumbs up for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marc D

customer_reviews.title: Close cut and the head pivots as well
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another Philips razor a year ago and it seemed to pull more than cut. This razor is so much better. No pull when using. Close cut and the head pivots as well as the individual heads move for a better closer and more comfortable shave. I am very glad I bought this one. It was also at a discount so that made it even a better value.
customer_reviews.author: RK bought this

customer_reviews.title: Philips Norelco always a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a 6 year old shaver. Almost identical to the first Husband loved the first one and ditto for this. Simple, no unnecessary trimmers here and there and everywhere. Price barely went up from previous time. Nice shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy Packer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok there is no good razors anymore
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ve been looking for a good razor for awhile. They don’t exist anymore all of them are just waste of $$ even if you go to the most $$$$ if your reading ALL the negative reviews most of the razors are just mass dumped by the thousands to cut a good shave, reliability and made to last a year! Where they get you is the rip off of the replaceable heads.
customer_reviews.author: Marine

product_meta.title: Philips Norelco AT830/41 Shaver 4500, Rechargeable Wet/Dry Electric Shaver, with Pop-up Trimmer & Cleaning Brush, Frustration Free Packaging
product_meta.description: Philips Norelco Shaver 4500 (Model # AT830/41) provides a powerful wet or dry shave while protecting your skin - especially on hard-to-reach areas like the neck. DualPrecision shaving heads tackle the longer hairs and the shortest stubble. The Pivot, Flex and Float System, the heads adjust to the face's every contour to quickly catch every hair, even on the neck and jawline. The Skin Protection System limits skin irritation. The integrated pop-up trimmer conveniently trims sideburns and moustaches. The Lithium-ion rechargeable battery delivers 50 minutes of cordless shaving after a 1 hour charge. A 3-minute quick-charge provides enough power for one cordless shave. Simply rinse device under faucet for easy cleaning. Shaver 4500 comes with a 45 day risk-free trial and a full 2-year warranty. For best results, replace shaving heads with HQ8 replacement heads every 12 months.
feature_bullets: Designed with your skin in mind, Philips Norelco Shaver 4500 lets you shave any way you want for a comfortable dry shave or refreshing wet shave with or without shaving cream or gel

Protect your skin with our unique Dual Precision shaving system to deliver a smooth shave that's gentle on your skin; The Philips Norelco Shaver 4500 effectively shaves both longer and shorter hair stubble
The pivot, flex & float heads follow every contour of your face to remain in close contact with skin for a fast shave that's also gentle on your skin
Ease of trimming with Pop Up trimmer to help complete your facial hair grooming routine; Ideal for trimming sideburns, goatees, mustaches and more
The rechargeable Lithium ion battery delivers the power of a corded shaver without the hassle of a cord with 50 minutes of shaving time
